patient_id: Unique anonymous/de-identified provider ID for the patient
treatment_name: treatment name, can be surgery, radotherapy,  drug name  or drug combination ( (radiotherapy, chemotherapy, targeted therapy, homorno-therapy))
treatment_starting_date: treatement starting date in month and year - this data will be transformed in tretamenet event sequences and no dates which are potentially sensitive will appear on the public PDX finder
treatment_event: IF DATES ARE ENTERED IN PREVIOUS COLUMN  - DON'T FILL,- treatment event order event 1 correspond to the 1st time a patient was  treated to generate a PDX, subsequent events are incremented by 1
elapsed_time: IF TREATMENT DATES ARE ENTERED IN PREVIOUS COLUMNS  - DON'T FILL, if not please provide the time difference between the 1st  event and the current one (in month unit preferably or indicate the units) - treatment event 1 should be 0, treatment event 2 should be 6 if 6 months have elapased between event 1 and  event 2 and treatment event 3 should be 9 if 9 months have elapsed between event 1 and  3
response_classification: classification used to define response to treatment
model_id: Unique identifier for PDX when treatment was concomitant with PDX creation.

treatment_name: list drugs or conpounds or suregry or radiotherapy, drug/treatment type needs to be separated by '+' if several
treatment_dose: add the dose and corresponding units
treatment_starting_date: starting date when patient was treated
treatment_event: combination between event and a number
elapsed_time: difference between current event and 1st  event- in months
treatment_response: when possible give response based on RECIST criteria, if not recist explain how response was calculated , NO acronyms
response_classification: classification used to define response to treatment based on RECIST or other criteria
model_id: this needs to be unique to represent an aggregated PDX line : combination between a mouse strain and a unique grafted tumour sample

treatment_event: if no dates in treatment starting dates this is essential otherwise desirable
elapsed_time: if no dates in treatment starting dates this is essential otherwise desirable
